cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas–south-central Louisiana coast (near the TX/LA border)

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: Yes (western edge, Day-4/5 part of cone)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches in effect for parts of the central Bahamas and eastern Cuba (does not include Texas coast at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, much of Hispaniola and parts of the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama likely to experience tropical-storm conditions; highest risk focused from upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds; occasional gusts to tropical-storm force possible late Wednesday into early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: If track shifts west some minor surge (1–2 ft) could occur; currently not expected to exceed 3 ft at Calhoun Port Authority
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring roughly 1–3 inches of rain; widespread 4-inch totals not expected under current track
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and minor coastal flooding could disrupt vessel movements even if direct storm impacts remain east of the port
